conclusion: Car A starts on the right side of the table and the arrow indicates its initial direction of motion is towards the left and slightly downwards.
The second image shows the car moving in the general direction towards the left and slightly downwards.
The first obstacles in the path of car A are the orange blocks stacked on the right, and car A will collide with the orange blocks.
Upon colliding with the orange blocks, car A will transfer some momentum to the blocks and be deflected towards the left.
After being deflected from the orange blocks, car A is likely to collide with one or more red blocks scattered in the central area.
Collisions with red blocks will cause further deflections and loss of energy, making it likely that car A will then collide with the green blocks.
Car A will eventually stop when its kinetic energy is completely dissipated, likely somewhere to the left of the green blocks or within the area occupied by the green blocks.
Car A will collide with the orange blocks, some red blocks, and the green blocks, and will eventually stop in the area around the green blocks.
